body:
[ ![E0EetUdXsAIBhK5 resized resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121914885-f8bb1080-cd32-11eb-898b-fa39bae7a331.jpeg)](https://mobile.twitter.com/EtienneBerthie2/status/1387426262306656265)

> Summary 
> 
> * we redesigned the question on appliances, asking for a list of appliances rather than an annual expense, and made the calculations more reliable
> * we launched the `conference` function on the home page
> 
> This version note borrows the name of the research work that analyzed the evolution of more than 200,000 terrestrial glaciers by analyzing satellite images. [More info here](https://mobile.twitter.com/EtienneBerthie2/status/1387426288646987777)

## Footprint of the appliances

We go from a monetary factor to a list of possessions.

![Capture d’écran du 2021-06-14 17-09-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915179-446dba00-cd33-11eb-8406-1eb0828a0e7d.png)

So we were probably overestimating the default footprint of household appliances by a lot, as noted [here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues/948)

Conversely, in this new version, the user is prevented from forgetting recent purchases, as he is presented with a list that is not complete, but already quite extensive 

We were overestimating the footprint of household appliances as well because it was attributed entirely to the individual. We now divide it by the number of inhabitants of the house 

## Conference mode launched in the foreground

The feature is now open to everyone on the home page 

It allows friends, colleagues and workgroups to calculate their footprint together in an interactive way.

![Capture d’écran du 2021-06-14 17-10-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915284-5ea79800-cd33-11eb-8530-fe334eef9cd7.png)

A new guide allows to understand the principle before starting.

![Capture d’écran du 2021-06-14 17-11-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/121915462-8434a180-cd33-11eb-850f-9b7fd909639b.png)

Room names in French are automatically generated to avoid having to think of a name.

Other bugs in the /conference mode have been solved.

body:
[![Glacier du Tour](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/50/Glacier_du_Tour_2021.jpg/270px-Glacier_du_Tour_2021.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier%5Fdu%5FTour) _The Glacier du Tour is located in the Chamonix valley, a valley accessible thanks to a superb mountain TER_

## Unpack your wardrobe

Finally, we no longer ask you the question of how much you _spend_ on textiles each year, which was too sensitive to the quality of your purchases. Instead of counting 50kg CO2e for a t-shirt bought for 100€, we count the t-shirt's footprint.

In return, it is up to you to catalog what you buy in general each year (or on average each year). A not so simple exercise... but rather interesting, no?

![Capture d’écran du 2021-08-24 08-57-41](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130571129-d0be75f2-989a-4f84-858d-0c8ce803e561.png)

## Subcategory visualization

As you go through the questions in the simulation, see the footprint of the subcategories at a glance.

![Capture d’écran du 2021-08-24 08-48-31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130569828-bee5d46a-0709-4e8a-ab6b-f94f54bbdf0d.png)

## Help notifications to understand the questions

![Capture d’écran du 2021-08-24 08-49-12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130569970-663eb9ac-4647-4943-b4de-befb12bcb7e2.png)

## Return of the "back" button

We had removed this button because it was leading to bugs, questions were skipping and definitely falling into nothingness. Following numerous requests, it is back and normally, without bugs!

![Capture d’écran du 2021-08-24 08-51-19](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130570246-0bebdfc3-4fae-40c8-9011-6999713fdcf9.png)

## For those who heat with oil 🛢️

We have quietly changed the main input, which was in kWh, to an input in liters. There is of course always the possibility to enter the price, we estimate the consumption in liters at the rates of the quarter published by the Ministry.

## New personas.

We did not communicate much on this functionality, but nosgestesclimat is equipped with a page `Personas`, which makes it possible to put itself in the skin of some individuals to see their result of simulation. It is here, and we added some: nosgestesclimat.fr/personas

> This page, improved, could become very important in the future: the personas could be designed to be representative of the French.

![Capture d’écran du 2021-08-24 08-54-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130570763-0101210c-3f08-49af-b376-572b649ad5d4.png)

## Various improvements

We always listen carefully to your feedbacks! 

### Input aids

we have improved the input help for the plane for those who don't take it every year[(details here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/commit/e3d74925b8ff31d6cf40531e6a07a1f97c9f1237))), and for the accommodation to accommodate the less classical lifestyles (camping car, truck, barge, [details here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/commit/e900598708402620bc3664500db4c1d111f24515).

### End screen

We added the decimal point in the final score of the test on the end screen

![ngc-fin-décimale](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/130571538-ff8753ce-78c6-4d64-a63c-9128c015545e.gif)

body:
[![périades](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116311567-ac7c3700-a7ab-11eb-8f01-8d486e2706f3.jpeg)](https://fr.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier%5Fdes%5FP%C3%A9riades)

> In summary 
> 
> * new issues and model for age consideration and housing materials
> * lots of new climate actions
> * a conference mode in preparation, already testable
> * bugs solved

## Age of housing

Previously, a dwelling built in 1901 had an annual construction footprint, as much as a dwelling built in 2019\. Ouch. This is fixed 

* age of the house -> taking into account or not a footprint, the houses > 50 years old are now zero
* declination house vs apartment
* declination traditional construction (concrete I think) vs eco-built

See https://github.com/datagir/nosgeste [sclimat/pull/994](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/994)

## Lots of new gestures to take action :boxing\_glove:

Which brings us to a good 20!

![Capture d’écran du 2021-04-27 17-51-06](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116272451-32cf5380-a781-11eb-8601-0e6ac7e83f9e.png)

![Capture d’écran du 2021-04-27 17-51-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116272430-2d720900-a781-11eb-9786-e09c5f5e8fcc.png)

But also 

* switch to LEDs at home
* go without the car for trips < 5km
* give up the tumble dryer
* replace my gas boiler with oil

After a last salvo, we will move on to improving the UX of this "climate action" part.

## A "conference" mode in preparation

On the PR number [222](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/222), you can follow the progress of a brand new simulation mode for our climate gestures : make the simulation with several people ! 

It will be useful for conferences, for workshops, but also to simply test it with friends.

To test it, [it is here 🏹 🏹](https://conf--nosgestesclimat.netlify.app/conf%C3%A9rence)

![Capture d’écran du 2021-04-27 17-59-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/116273752-5515a100-a782-11eb-8483-c378c2c7406e.png)

## Bonus : obsolescence of computer equipment

We have heart to fight against the digital footprint by not neglecting the devices that have a lower definition than the current standard. Here is a small improvement that goes in this direction: https: [//github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues/995](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues/995)

body:
![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Absolute_MtBlanc_01.jpg/400px-Absolute_MtBlanc_01.jpg)

> In short: Food, average footprint and some bugs

For this 2nd version of Our Climate Gestures, we listened to the already numerous feedbacks and made these main changes.

## Food item

We introduce the choice of breakfast type 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/91868807-6ea72d00-ec75-11ea-81bb-982cac0ea55a.png)

As well as a new diet selector, much less rigid than a single diet.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/91868962-9c8c7180-ec75-11ea-86fc-2f12f26baf35.png)

## More representative default values

The simulator, by default, now indicates 11.7 tons, a figure closer to the average footprint of a French person (we were previously at 10) 

## Removal of the "finance" item

As explained in #24 , the attribution of a footprint to the money we have in the bank was a double counting. We have removed it.

## 🐛 shared car bug

In short, we were significantly overestimating the footprint of the shared car rental.

We now attribute a share of the vehicle's construction to each person who rents a car to get around. We were making the mistake of attributing _all of the_ construction to him

[![Glacier des Gabiétous](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/45/Jeu_de_lumiere_aux_deux_alpes_02.JPG/640px-Jeu_de_lumiere_aux_deux_alpes_02.JPG)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Les%5FDeux%5FAlpes)

> The two alps glacier is closed early this year

> In brief :
> 
> * New breakfasts & hot drinks
> * New waste calculation model
> * Suggestions for answers in the form of buttons
> * Optimization of the weight of the site

## New breakfasts & hot drinks 🥐☕️

![width="800" alt="question-boissons-chaudes"](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/180246298-6037be7a-cd19-4d7c-b1b4-d14e9a7456b8.png)

The breakfast question has been improved with new suggestions. A hot beverage question also makes an appearance!

## New waste calculation model 🚮

The trash footprint is evolving! A more accurate model updates the waste footprint with a more recent source. All discussions are in [this thread](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1110). A mosaic of eco-gestures has also been added.

![mosaique éco-gestes](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/180496611-dda2a38b-67ec-4f47-9136-6f4ce798d167.png) 

## Suggested responses in the form of buttons ✨

The suggestions are now more visible. Some mosaics also show suggestions, which did not exist before, like the meal selection! 

![width="800" alt="suggestions-repas"](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/180241201-1fe64d79-03ee-43f8-a26b-34ac1b515ee8.gif)

## Optimization of the weight of the site ↘️

In terms of the weight of the loaded javascript, we go from 1.4mo to 1.1, which is -20%. The performance of the site has been improved in an eco-design approach. The only visible difference is the font. All the advances at this level are in [this discussion](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/478).

body:
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/80/Aerial_view_of_Glacier_du_G%C3%A9ant.jpg/640px-Aerial_view_of_Glacier_du_G%C3%A9ant.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier%5Fdu%5FG%C3%A9ant)

## English version 🇬🇧

Hi everyone! Our Climate Gestures is coming in English 💂

![Recording 2022-11-09 at 18 52 42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/200904084-6051257b-e0ce-4483-8d91-05b5bbd44e0b.gif)

Of course, translation is a long-term task, so if you find a problem, we have a page dedicated to feedback 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/200904709-d6a19333-9c70-4033-bb15-bafde6661794.png)

Soon it will also be possible to calculate your climate footprint in Spanish, Italian, and then new languages 

> Be careful, translation is not internationalization of the model: for the moment, there are only two calculation models, Metropolitan France and Guadeloupe. The others are coming soon!

## Brand new figures for the food footprint

We have improved the footprints of the lunch and dinner dishes 

First, we have improved the calculation of the emission factor of the most important component of the meals, meat and fish. Instead of a simple average, we now do an average weighted by national consumption (for example, for the dish "meat 1", pork and chicken are no longer equally important) 

Secondly, there was a global update of agribalysis in October, which corrected overestimated emission factors. We have updated our figures with these 

[More info](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1525).

[![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/200906087-5748cab9-d053-48dd-b169-3038dcf50fa2.png)](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/documentation/alimentation/plats/viande-1)

## Improved navigation during and after the test

It is [now easier](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/677) to navigate through the categories and answers already given after the test 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/193876373-fd942951-afb3-40ec-8316-480b9bdf7241.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/193876420-5203196f-54af-42fb-b61b-9e2822da9a59.png)

In the same vein, a new `Find My Simulation` button appears on the home page, and the progress of the test in % on the profile page. [More info](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/672).

## A new page to explain our fossil dependency

A [new page](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/p%C3%A9trole-et-gaz) to explain the stakes of reducing our oil and gas consumption. Indeed, climate is only one of them, and we are going through a period where inflation and geopolitical tensions are more and more integrated in the equation.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/200906228-cb2db1ba-3083-48eb-9a96-26f0fb02daf1.png)

body:
> In short: 🚀 This is the 1st beta version of Our Climate Gestures, released in June 2020\. 

![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/65/Refuge_et_Pic_de_l'%C3%89tendard_(Savoie).JPG/400px-Refuge_et_Pic_de_l'%C3%89tendard_(Savoie).JPG)

It's essentially a rehash of the 2.6 model of Avenir Climatique's MicMac tool, which resided in a downloadable spreadsheet file. MicMac Web was no longer updated, so a new version of the interface had to be launched, one that was more modern, interactive, easy to evolve, and made the calculations completely transparent 

This repository contains the complete calculation model of Our Climate Gestures, in the form of YAML [publicodes](https://publi.codes) files.

The tool is in _beta_ version: it is usable and already informative, but we have already identified many unsatisfactory points 

* the total is not the 11.2 tons expected
* the numerical part is not complete, the footprint is underestimated
* the only question for the diet is very disappointing
* etc.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/89622912-0e9ab200-d894-11ea-9226-c4af37549cd7.png)

body:
[![Glacier de las Néous](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a8/Glacier_de_Las_N%C3%A9ous_8_ao%C3%BBt_1905.png/547px-Glacier_de_Las_N%C3%A9ous_8_ao%C3%BBt_1905.png)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier%5Fde%5Flas%5FN%C3%A9ous)

> In short:
> 
> * a tutorial is displayed before the test
> * seasonal, local food
> * we help you to fill up your car miles
> * many new content on the screen / actions
> * lots of other improvements to the template and the site

## A tutorial before the test 🧑🏫

We've added a tutorial for those unfamiliar with the concept of climate footprints and personal consumption climate footprints. This is part of our strategy to open up to audiences not yet aware of these topics.

[The Ministry of the Environment is demoing this here](https://twitter.com/i/status/1488059482647236608)

## Seasonal, local food 🌻 🚛

From Agribalyse, we have developed climate footprint variation models corresponding to seasonal and local diets 

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/140048614-299fc659-6c87-441c-ab91-4b79e7c44b11.gif)

To our knowledge, these improvements are groundbreaking work! You will see that these "options" have little influence if your diet is not already strongly vegetarian 

## New screen to help you enter mileage while driving ⌨️ 🛣️

You may have noticed that it's hard to answer the question "How many miles do you drive each year?" all at once 

So have we: so we've designed a form to help with that entry 

![Aide à la saisie km voiture - démo](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151338682-c79c82d3-4582-4981-98ab-401dc8c81206.gif)

Big bonus: this form also avoids estimating a vehicle fill rate, which is usually a very risky task 

## Improvements to the "action" path 🎯

* two new actions to switch to seasonal and local food
* we have improved the action to reduce the temperature of your home: we now ask you your current temperature
* a new action to go vegan
* we separated the actions into different ranges, from "more than a ton" to "less than 10kg", and finally to "unquantified actions".

## Gas prices 🔥

You will surely have seen it: gas prices are exploding in France. Between +40% and +110% in a few months. So we have revised upwards our tool to help estimate kWh from €/month 

To do so, we have reimplemented the gas bill at the regulated rate, including the various taxes and subscriptions that modify this figure.

## New profile page

A small button appears on the home page, it indicates that you already have data on nosgestesclimat.fr. As before, we have no data on our servers, everything is local on your browser 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852468-1e9d0cf1-a19e-4540-8c9a-2bf9beb0c6da.png)

Above all, the profile page has a new look, it is now much easier to navigate through your answers 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852657-f06c1d34-fc05-4c4a-8d23-8304cacfc4ea.png)

## Ecodesign 🏋️

_Let's keep in mind that the footprint of the service and use of a website in France is very small and already in general naturally optimized by developers. The environmental impact of digital is mainly related to manufacturing [(70% for example for a smartphone)](https://librairie.ademe.fr/cadic/5311/infographie-preferer-smartphone-reconditionne.pdf?modal=false)._

### Small screens

We continue to work to support small screens 

Here are the improvements on iPhone5 SE 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/144875622-2991b5a6-69c9-4c04-9422-48c727cc81af.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/144875673-c96e2098-22bb-4e71-b993-3c121fd008a6.png)

To do this, we have optimized the footprint distribution graph, integrating the texts in the bars. It has also been animated, which makes it much easier to understand the impact of choices in the input 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/151852263-5fb7fe31-e13e-4ce5-96a8-4794d19f5ce7.png)

### Hosting the site

We [asked](https://answers.netlify.com/t/low-carbon-european-cdn/48784) our host (Netlify), if it would be possible for them to implement a server in France so that our users could see their site served from France, rather than from Germany currently 

## Coming in 2022

See our roadmap for the calculation model [here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/projects/1)

[![Glacier de Tré-la-Tête](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/Glacier_de_Tr%C3%A9-la-T%C3%AAte.jpg/640px-Glacier_de_Tr%C3%A9-la-T%C3%AAte.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier%5Fde%5FTr%C3%A9-la-T%C3%AAte)

> This glacier of Tré-la-Tête is the 4th largest glacier in France. An [interesting](https://www.francetvinfo.fr/meteo/canicule/video-un-glaciologue-repond-a-cinq-questions-sur-les-glaciers%5F5283679.html) 📽️ [Brut video about it following the unusual summer of 2022 (29/07/2022)](https://www.francetvinfo.fr/meteo/canicule/video-un-glaciologue-repond-a-cinq-questions-sur-les-glaciers%5F5283679.html)

> **In a nutshell** 
> 
> * new logo, new iconography, new home page
> * a lot of small improvements to the site and the calculation model

## 🎨 A new logo, a new homepage, and new icons

You won't have missed it, Our Climate Gestures is getting a new logo 🥳 

![](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/images/petit-logo.png)

Frequently quoted in the press, it will go even less unnoticed there 

Here are some extracts from the last two weeks alone ⬇️ 

[Ouest-France](https://www.ouest-france.fr/bretagne/carhaix-plouguer-29270/a-carhaix-ces-specialistes-de-l-energie-donnent-leurs-conseils-pour-consommer-moins-bc1250aa-3346-11ed-8dd8-fdb9fa809eb1) article: In Carhaix, these energy specialists give their advice to consume less

> It is also possible to calculate its carbon footprint on nosgestesclimat.fr

Article from [France Inter](https://www.radiofrance.fr/franceinter/un-champion-de-trail-nous-explique-pourquoi-il-renonce-a-une-course-en-raison-de-son-bilan-carbone-7787049): A high level runner explains why he is giving up the World Championships because of his carbon footprint 

> Andy Symonds calculated, via the website "Nos gestes climat", that flying to Thailand would explode his carbon footprint.

 The Dauphiné Libéré [launched a survey and quotes NGC](https://www.ledauphine.com/environnement/2022/09/21/les-citoyens-attendent-que-l-etat-les-accompagne-dans-leurs-efforts) Find the results of our survey "The French and their carbon footprint 

> A French person emits on average 11.2 tons of CO2e per year. Experts estimate that this figure should be limited to 2 tons per year to curb climate change and meet the objectives of the Paris Agreement. To find out your carbon footprint, Ademe has launched an online tool called "Our climate actions".

As well as[outside.fr](https://www.outside.fr/comment-evaluer-votre-empreinte-carbone-les-3-meilleurs-calculateurs).

The homepage follows this graphic evolution with a few paragraphs to introduce the subject (and its limits) 

### Before

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323489-088461c2-b1b9-46fe-bce2-c1e459104569.png)

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323550-993c5109-ae91-4baa-8853-af240bf4c279.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/191323669-952493a1-7b17-4d38-a48b-313f2a592863.png)

In the same way, we worked on [the style and readability of the](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/570) business [icons](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/570) throughout the site.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/192312016-67af3382-6e02-49db-b791-8ba1702eb0ce.png)

## 🐎 Performance (eco-design)

We finished phase 2 of our sobriety work, in terms of site weight, with a [significant gain](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/602). It's all relative, but a little sobriety on our end is the least we can do!

## 👆️ Other interface improvements

* The [survey mode](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe) is no longer in beta, it has already been used by hundreds of organizations
* a notification appears when your home is depreciated (= built a long time ago): in this case, we don't ask you its surface notably (because we don't need it for the calculation), this surprised some users
* the input of numbers in the questionnaire is now more constrained (you can't fill in zero passengers in the car for example) to reduce the errors that can cause non-expected values (infinite or null values)
* the button "I don't know" appears in the mosaics[(https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/604)](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/604)
* the accessibility certificate[(https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/621)](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/621) is online, testifying to our work on this important aspect of Web sites

Overall, a lot of work has been done on sorting and closing hundreds of return tickets, [on the template side](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/issues) as well as [on the site side](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues), the contribution of as many people as possible always remains our priority.

## 🧮 On the model side

* update of the [aircraft emission factors](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1489)
* the "consumption" part of the tea [is already included in your electricity bill](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1494), it was a bug spotted thanks to our parallel work on [monconvertisseurco2.fr](https://monconvertisseurco2.fr/empreinte-carbone/boisson)
* the emission factor of the French electricity mix for 2021 [is updated](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1484)

## 🌅 Coming soon...

We are currently working on a regionalization (overseas) and internationalization of the site 😎. See you soon!
name: Tré-la-Tête

body:
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2b/Guadeloupe_from_ISS.jpg/640px-Guadeloupe_from_ISS.jpg?uselang=fr)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guadeloupe)

> In brief 
> 
> * the first regional version to go beyond metropolitan France
> * a contributing internationalization platform
> * more and more improvements of the model: default values for heating, air conditioning, biogas

## UCS international 🗺️

We launch the internationalization and regionalization with [a first new territory: Guadeloupe](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/626)!

This essential work that we had put aside for the moment was motivated by the initiative of [Samuel Charvet](https://gp.linkedin.com/in/samuel-charvet-830773223) student at the University of the West Indies in Point-à-Pitre 

![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/193768356-bfd5da7b-7883-4d5e-8b89-bd252b704565.png) 

The customization of the electric mix factor, the localized suggestions for the plane and the addition of the inter-island ferry are the main features of the Guadeloupe version, which will obviously evolve.

This is only a first brick, our goal being to create a community of contributors first in France, then in Europe and in the world 

## Adding air conditioning ❄️

Differentiating the model for Guadeloupe allowed us to realize the importance of air conditioning, and the relative importance of heating (for hot water) in this tropical region where no month is significantly colder than another 

Initially reserved for Guadeloupe, we have extended [this air conditioning model](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/documentation/logement/climatisation) to metropolitan France (in fact, the standard model at this stage because it is historical) given the extent of air conditioning equipment in 2020: 25% of households would have it 

Its footprint is twofold: its electricity consumption (particularly carbon intensive in Guadeloupe) _and_ its greenhouse gas leakage, which is significant (several hundred kg of CO2e per air conditioner per year) even in a France with a decarbonized electricity mix.

The subject is complex (as it often is), so this model is only a [first iteration](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1488) to be refined 

## Biogas 🔥🌱

It's a question asked many times: what about "green gas", also called biogas and more precisely biomethane? 

We investigated the[footprint of biogas](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/documentation/logement/gaz/biogaz) and validated the possibility of adding it in our calculation, it's done 

> ⚠️ Beware, this is absolutely not a perfect solution, which should not replace the more perennial reduction of its gas consumption via electrification, sobriety and energy efficiency.

## Heating: average values 🌡️

A [work on the average values of heating simulation](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/pull/1433) has been done by carefully analyzing the statistics of the [French housing stock](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/documentation/parc-fran%C3%A7ais).

## Tech ⚙️

As you may know, the particularity of ourgestesclimat is to be a form generated from an [open calculation model](nosgestesclimat.fr/documentation). This is what makes it particularly robust to changes, as we don't painstakingly order questions by hand, and we don't recode entanglements like "if the user said they live in an apartment, then don't ask them about the lawnmower": it's all handled for us 

The management of "mosaic" questions (the "heating" checkboxes or the choice of lunch and dinner menus) has been improved, and now resides directly in [the model](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/blob/master/docs/mosaic.md), alongside the other questions! 

What's the point? This allows contributors who don't want to bother with Javascript (and other coder considerations) to modify the questions in a very easy to access language

body:
![C'est à l'assemblée nationale dans le 7ème arrondissement de Paris qu'est voté chaque année le budget de l'État](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/205978955-88a0ad61-244c-4afb-89a9-600eef3a5f1c.jpg)

If you have ever done a carbon footprint test, you may have noticed a rather surprising category: utilities. About 1 ton out of the French average of 10 tons, it may not seem like much... However, for those who adopt a rather low-carbon lifestyle, and more generally in relation to the objective of 2 tons of individual footprint (remember that the important thing is not the objective but the [transition scenario](https://datagir.ademe.fr/blog/budget-empreinte-carbone-c-est-quoi/)), 1 ton can legitimately look like an elephant in the room! 

In this article, we tell you all about this famous "public services" or now "societal services" item in UCS: how it is calculated, what it is composed of, and how we just used these numbers to make a **✨ new version of the calculation model of nosgestesclimat.fr** 

## The average French person emits 8.9 tons (November 2022)

France, like many other countries, has set commitments to reduce its climate footprint 

To achieve this, we obviously need to know _where we are_ today and how things are evolving each year 

This is the task of the Ministry of Ecology's [Data and Statistical Studies Department](https://www.statistiques.developpement-durable.gouv.fr/), which [estimates it at 8.9 tons per person in 2021](https://www.statistiques.developpement-durable.gouv.fr/lempreinte-carbone-de-la-france-de-1995-2021?rubrique=27&dossier=1286)

How is this figure calculated? The explanation of the calculation is [transparent but relatively difficult to understand](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/files/9980633/methodologie%5Fempreinte%5Fcarbone%5Foctobre2021%5F0.pdf), so we will simply explain the principle of this clever calculation 

Basically, to calculate a climate footprint, you have to start from a physical reality. We have to calculate the real greenhouse gas emissions (well, estimate it) of a concrete action: for example, we know that burning 1 liter of gasoline in a car emits about [2.7 kg of CO2](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/documentation/transport/voiture/thermique/empreinte-au-litre). Then, we can count the liters of diesel burned by French semi-trailers, by barges on rivers, by boats, planes, etc 

The problem then, is to calculate the footprint of other sectors, which do not directly burn these fossil fuels. For example, a hospital buys wooden furniture but does not manufacture or transport it itself. The furniture is cut up in a factory, which bought it. For this, a truck delivered wooden boards to them. This wood was treated by the chemical industry, and produced by the forestry industry (the management of forest wood), which uses diesel chainsaws, etc 

The administration does not have a precise description of all these transactions (kg of wood, volume of oil and paint, etc.), but it does have the exchanges in € between all these sectors, at an aggregated level over the year, called macro. Thanks to these monetary exchanges, a matrix calculation allows us to attribute to each sector the carbon footprint of its added value!

These calculations are made periodically. The latest accurate version is for the year 2017, and the latest (less accurate) estimate is for 2021 

## Defining the perimeter of a base assigned to each French person

By summing up the footprint of all these sectors, divided by the population of the country, this gives [the](https://base--nosgestesclimat.netlify.app/documentation/empreinte-SDES?PR=1584) so-called "macro" [footprint](https://base--nosgestesclimat.netlify.app/documentation/empreinte-SDES?PR=1584) per person 

In parallel, the calculation model of nosgestesclimat is a compilation of so-called "micro" models: you are asked a multitude of questions to reconstruct _your carbon footprint_ from physical consumption data.

> These are two perspectives on the same physical reality, two very different methods producing two figures, which fortunately converge around 9 tons of CO2e 

These two methods are very different but they are also complementary: indeed, the analysis by consumption cannot capture all the emissions of a French person. If the micro method of nosgestesclimat allows to easily calculate the footprint of your car kilometers, it is unable to estimate the footprint of public services that you use in a diffuse way all year long, as well as commercial services such as the fiber and mobile internet network that most of the population benefits from in a latent way (admittedly in a variable way). It is therefore necessary to adopt a hybrid model, which mixes micro and macro.

> The header photo of this article illustrates the problem: it is easy to estimate the climate footprint of the truck, the car and the motorcycle. But what about the footprint of this regularly re-bituminized road? What about the maintenance of the road signs? Of the footprint of the operation of the national assembly itself? 

The objective is then to define the perimeter of these complementary worlds in order to avoid double counting, and thus obtain the final value of the constant societal services, the sum of public services and commercial services, attributed to each French person.

![Recording 2022-12-12 at 18 08 09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/207108876-1334c2b0-8275-43d5-a899-81d04c2230d9.gif)

## A first calculation

We have therefore analyzed the macro footprint data, [shared by the SDES](https://www.statistiques.developpement-durable.gouv.fr/la-decomposition-de-lempreinte-carbone-de-la-demande-finale-de-la-france-par-postes-de-consommation), by sector, line by line, to include a share, from 0 to 100%, to the societal services footprint 

> It should be remembered that the objective is always to**obtain orders of magnitude**: it is not a question of claiming a result to the nearest 10 kg of CO2\. In this respect, it should be remembered that our climate objectives target a 90% reduction in our footprint 

The line "Public administration and defense" is of course automatically included in the public services: the citizen has no influence on these governmental positions other than through his vote and his public commitment 

Things get more complicated for example for the item "🏗️ construction": it includes many diverse activities benefiting the whole society, yet we do not have the details of their carbon footprint. An allocation is therefore made on the basis of the turnover of the sub-branches and sub-sub-branches [published by INSEE](https://www.insee.fr/fr/statistiques/4226067?sommaire=4226092), these are the % that you can see appearing in our documentation 

_Learn more about the breakdown by turnover of the SDES carbon data_ 

> The data provided by the SDES gives a carbon footprint corresponding to what is consumed on the French territory by economic branch (e.g.: E36 = water distribution network = 677 kTCO2e) or by group of economic branches (e.g.: F41\_43 = Construction = 54116 kTCO2e) For this data, there is a first level of aggregation that we have chosen to disaggregate according to the share of turnover [of the branch](https://www.insee.fr/fr/statistiques/4226067?sommaire=4226092) in the grouping proposed by the SDES (e.g.: for F41\_43, we have F41=25%, F42=13.5%, F43=61.5%)
> 
> Some data are secret, we have made the assumption that these data were also secret for the calculation of the national carbon footprint. In the absence of additional information, we chose not to consider them in these decomposition calculations.
> 
> To go even further, we sometimes needed a higher level of precision by looking at the economic sub-branches. Indeed, if we take the example of E38 relating to waste collection, only sub-branches E3812 and E3822, concerning hazardous waste, were to be included in the public services. We have therefore also used the decomposition by turnover to highlight the carbon intensity associated with the sub-branches in question within E38.

For market services, we tried to include in the baseline footprint those consumptions that are relatively universal (e.g., everyone has to buy home insurance) or those that are not yet captured by our micro models (e.g., consumption of telecom services) but may one day be 

If you are interested, you can explore our documentation that explains and justifies this allocation via the [utilities](https://base--nosgestesclimat.netlify.app/documentation/services-publics?PR=1584) and [market](https://base--nosgestesclimat.netlify.app/documentation/services-marchands?PR=1584) services pages. It is quite "expert", we did the best we could for a first version, your feedback will be valuable.

## The result

Here is a photograph of our hybrid model 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/207576758-03cfbc96-a6a2-4817-a4cb-4c4562342783.png)

⚠️ Beware, do not see in this graph a reliable average value of the climate footprint of a French person, [contrary to the SDES figure of 8.9t](https://www.statistiques.developpement-durable.gouv.fr/lempreinte-carbone-de-la-france-de-1995-2021?rubrique=27&dossier=1286), but simply the anatomy of our hybrid calculation model. The values are likely to change regularly, in full transparency 

The objective of Nos Gestes Climat remains to estimate the footprint associated with the lifestyle of a real person. By the way, the objective of the next versions is precisely to cover many items that are currently left out 🐕️⛴️🛵⚡️🏡. See you soon!
name: L'empreinte climat des "services sociétaux"

body:
[![Glacier de Gébroulaz](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a4/Glacier_de_G%C3%A9broulaz2.jpg/640px-Glacier_de_G%C3%A9broulaz2.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier%5Fde%5FG%C3%A9broulaz)

> In brief:
> 
> * Survey mode arrives
> * A new metric : oil
> * Improvements in the calculation model: caravan, camping car, car fuel, digital ...
> * Improvements in the actions: buy an electric car, subsidy for the purchase of a bicycle
> * New educational resources

## Arrival of the survey mode! 💾

* **What is it?**The "survey" mode in Our Climate Gestures allows you to do the test with several people while saving the data permanently (total carbon footprint and by category). This mode can be particularly interesting in the context of a workshop or an event, a [facilitator guide](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe/guide) is available to help you!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/171632300-dba6d437-a9bd-44b3-afc3-874c1e7307d6.png)

* **The**arrival of this new mode is accompanied by an additional feature that allows you to add a few questions to collect additional information as an introduction to the test. For example, this can be useful to organize a survey at the scale of an organization while allowing to filter the results by type of respondent (status...), age, place of living (while taking care not to compromise the standards of RGPD). We have also worked on the security of the surveys to avoid the introduction of vulnerabilities in our database via this feature. You can find all the info in our [documentation](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe/documentation-contexte)!
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/171632420-ada9f5c5-b1ab-45a5-b0f7-05d95df2b3bc.png) 
* **In**the previous version, any user who logged in to the survey was displayed in the graph. Some people counted as 1 participant without even having taken the test (with a score corresponding to the default values) and the ghost visits distorted the results (especially the average value!). This is no longer the case in this version since the data displayed is filtered by excluding users who completed less than 10% of the test questions. In case the survey is customized (see above), an additional filter is applied to display only the participants who completed the context questions.

## A new metric: oil! 🛢

To better visualize the amount of oil we consume in our lives, we decided to add to Our Climate Gestures the number of corresponding full tanks, in addition to the CO₂e. For the moment, this metric is only reported to direct emissions related to oil (travel, oil heating ...). The way to both highlight our dependence on these fossil fuels but also to better visualize the impact of actions we can put in place: the number of fills speaks more than the tons of CO₂e, so swipe on the end screen to see your oil impact!

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/171646402-b2d769d1-0626-4a0d-8903-90b7727383e0.png) 

## Improvements to the calculation model 🧮

* **Added caravan & motorhome**There are now more choices in Our Climate Gestures for going on vacation! Caravans and motor homes have found their place. Attention, for the caravan, the number of kilometers traveled is well to include in the kilometers traveled by car. More information on the methodology in issue #1317![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/160854704-aa5b1010-e8f9-43cb-966b-ba80e6a8f731.png)
* **Change in the passenger ratio**With the arrival of the assistance in entering the kilometers in [the last release](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/nouveaut%C3%A9s/las-n%C3%A9ous), a question remained as to the choice of the vehicle's fill rate applied to attribute the depreciation to the different users of the car. The details are available in issue #1337 and in the [note of the "passenger ratio" variable](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/8fe4b633502fe52dda7eccdc0e9db01b9f677e57/data/transport/transport%20.%20voiture.yaml#L53)
* **More choice of fuels**Diesel (B7 or B10), gasoline (E5 or E10) or E85 gasoline (biofuels), you can choose! However, beware of the message sent to the user when he selects biofuels. The carbon impact is certainly lower, but the emission factor is particularly uncertain: the issues related to land use are not taken into account! A notification is therefore displayed to explain this issue! All the info and discussions are in the corresponding issue #1396!
* **Improvement of the digital mosaic**New objects have been added for the digital objects mosaic #1359 :  
   * 🎵 bluetooth speaker  
   * 🔊 voice speaker  
   * ⌚️ connected watch  
   * 🕹 living room console  
   * 🎮 portable console
* **New heating modes**It is now possible to choose the heat pump (#1360)! Thoughts are underway to add heat networks as well.

## Improvements in actions 💪

* **A "Buy an electric car" action makes its appearance**. Proposed in case you already own a car, this action allows users to realize the impact (positive or negative) of buying a new or used electric car according to the kilometers driven per year.  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/171641150-ec39e53c-2565-43ae-8379-1b97691c8f03.png)
* **Adding mesaidesvelo.fr in the actions**Adding a link to [mesaidesvelo.fr](https://mesaidesvelo.fr/) in the relevant actions. The tool is developed by @mquandalle, who is a developer on mon-entreprise.fr, and mesaidesvelo.fr is already integrated on the official website <https://www.1jeune1solution.gouv.fr/>.  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/171675160-9cd5c968-d2ba-473a-8ca1-8e316ec041f2.png)

## A new way to contribute 👥

Contributing is made easier for non-devs contributors! Repositories have been configured to allow you to modify or add new features in real time via a development environment directly in your browser. We explain everything in the [Gitpod tutorial](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#vous-voulez-contribuer-comme-un-pro)! 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/55186402/171634543-25c6a773-849c-4931-9aef-a96df5506334.png) 

## New resources 📚

To help you during your animations but also to allow you to question your own results, [guide sheets are online](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/groupe/guide)! 

**Full Changelog:** <https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat/compare/1.5.0...1.6.0>

> In short: transportation question improvements 🚦 ℹ This is a small version, with some improvements but nothing earth-shattering. It's only a minor release.

* your last simulation done on the browser, if there is one is automatically loaded 🧙♂️
* we have separated the calculation of the aircraft footprint ✈ into three questions, by mail type: short, medium, long. The calculation is more reliable. We also ask the question "do you fly" beforehand to free those who are not concerned by this emission item
* we added a FAQ ❔ on the /contribute page. Indeed, we have many (many) feedbacks, often similar.
* we improved the car questions 🚗, especially to avoid talking about "your" car when the user said he didn't have one
* the 🚗 emoji was not suitable to represent the transportation category, leading some people who use only a little car, but other means of transportation to believe a bug in our model. It is now this one: 🚦

> In short: the nosgestesclimat.fr calculation engine has been completely modernized

In this version, not much changes for users, and that's even the goal: to completely revise the underlying code without introducing :bug: .

Our Climate Gestures is now cleanly based on publi.codes. We have thus made up for the 8 months of improvements that the betagouv/my-company team made to this language, and removed the mountain of code that represented publicodes and that we were not actively developing here :+1 

![Capture d’écran du 2021-01-25 11-20-07](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105692891-4a3b3e00-5eff-11eb-93a3-91bfd9c78378.png)

We have thus taken one more step in the openness, readability, and reproducibility of the calculation model we are developing here, and thus one more step towards an individual climate footprint calculation model that would serve as a reference

body:
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f3/Merdeglace.jpg)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mer%5Fde%5FGlace)

## Our Climate Gestures, v1

> In summary 
> 
> * the action screen has been completely redesigned with two paths and more gestures
> * the application has been partially redesigned: it is more modern and pleasant to use, especially on cell phones
> * we introduce _personas_, to better work on the next actions
> * share your simulation result on the networks, and people will see directly a capture of your assessment!

## Take action

We have completely redesigned the action screen.

We now have access to two modes, a guided mode where actions are sorted by us, and a standalone mode that allows us to tackle the biggest reduction actions.

![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 15-53-21](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112846986-e5d75f00-90a6-11eb-8ca0-1be5736d5d9c.png)

The selection of gestures is now more complete, there are now 17, in all categories.

![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 15-54-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112847173-161efd80-90a7-11eb-8f47-283dd1eb418a.png)

## Redesign of the application, especially on mobile

* we adopt the conventions of the modern mobile, with navigation buttons accessible with the finger at the bottom, and a session bar that gives the result of simulation also at the bottom and permanent

![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 11-05-15 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813673-c3c9e680-907e-11eb-94c9-b818073b7c45.png)

* on the action screen, the session bar remains predictable, in the same place but with the color of the category

![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 11-07-12 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813831-f07dfe00-907e-11eb-9d4c-240dbaa7d74a.png)

* we have gained vertical space on mobile. Why is this important? To make phones < 6 inches last. Not because 6 inches is bad, but because changing phones just for the screen is a shame. It won't revolutionize our footprint, but it's something!

Before![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 10-52-39 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813510-8ebd9400-907e-11eb-8db7-e2291ed24eaa.png)After![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 10-52-51 resized](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112813516-8f562a80-907e-11eb-9ead-773133ff889c.png)

## Simulation sharing

Big new feature that allows you to preview the results of a simulation when sharing on social networks. We hope to improve the diffusion of the application. Below is a Whatsapp capture.

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112972961-1d9ae100-9151-11eb-9f34-bc3061ca35da.png)

See [this PR](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/pull/208).

## Introduction of personas

This system, to be populated with profiles if possible representative of the population, will allow us to better test and develop the application.

![Capture d’écran du 2021-03-29 15-50-57](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/112846716-a14bc380-90a6-11eb-8060-219bed3d3ddf.png)

## Bug fixes

We corrected a big bug: the "previous" button of the simulation was badly done. We removed it, fixed the same problem that affected the "my answers" button, which now becomes the only way to modify your answers. It has been widely promoted.

body:
[![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/96420391-bf5af100-11f5-11eb-9662-fbcbd1445ea0.png)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier%5Fd'Argenti%C3%A8re)

> In short: introduction of the action sheets and a better car model

## Integration of the action sheets

After the simulation, we now offer you a list of actions that significantly reduce your footprint 

![Capture d’écran du 2021-01-25 11-23-53](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105693284-d2b9de80-5eff-11eb-8229-9c7dfd4f2a63.png)

We have also integrated a detailed documentation for each of these actions![Capture d’écran du 2021-01-25 11-26-37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/105693599-347a4880-5f00-11eb-94c2-51a179b8bd48.png)

## Big improvement of the model: the construction of the vehicle 🚗

It is now amortized over several years. Previously, it was depreciated over age, so an electric car bought 1 year ago would have its 12 tons attributed to that first year all at once, among other problems 

The depreciation method is explained [here](https://ecolab.ademe.fr/apps/climat/documentation/transport/voiture/amortissement-particulier).

We also forgot to divide the construction of the vehicle by the number of passengers, as it was done for the use of the car.

See #674 for all the thinking behind it.

## Other improvements ✨

It is clarified that we are asking for the energy consumption of the household, not the individual. This is especially thoughtful for collocates who may each have their own amount in mind.

We improved the texts of the questions on cars, and better documented the calculations.
name: Argentière

body:
[![Glacier de Taconnaz](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c8/Taconnaz.JPG/576px-Taconnaz.JPG)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier%5Fde%5FTaconnaz)

> In a nutshell 
> 
> * redesign of the action path 🎯: slip actions into your cart to reduce your footprint
> * the fish menu 🐟️ has finally arrived!
> * a new permanent menu makes it easier to navigate
> * you can now share your conference links with a QRcode

## A new path to action 🎯

Many users were complaining about the simplicity of our move-to-action path. We've redesigned it entirely, bringing it closer to a mini-game where the goal is to reduce your footprint 

![ngc-action-2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139829768-5759d428-1e0d-4c7d-9fd3-682dbebb1b90.gif)

This is just the beginning: we have already planned the [next steps](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues/359) to make engagement even easier.

We're also introducing _personas_: typical profiles you can select to experience the action journey as a given citizen 

## The menu 🐟️

We've received dozens of requests to integrate a fish menu on the diet choice screen. There are now 2! 

![Capture d’écran du 2021-11-02 11-29-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830102-bd7cee54-c1fd-454c-8eb0-7ce2a750ffa8.png)

These new dishes were made from the [Agribalyse](https://agribalyse.fr/) database, and the calculation is of course _open_. Many new features on food will follow 

## A new menu for the application

Nosgestesclimat is designed to be used on mobile as on desktop. The mobile version now has a permanent menu at the bottom of the screen, and the desktop version of a new arrangement in two columns, with a menu also present on the left 

![Capture d’écran du 2021-11-02 11-31-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830463-203c8896-0eda-49ad-ba45-be1a19e180de.png)

This new menu makes the application more accessible, and it's just one of many accessibility improvements we have [planned](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues/350).

## The French average is now 9 tons!

Unfortunately, this does not reflect unexpected efforts, but an improvement of the calculation method of the Ministry of the Environment 

The good news is that the French administration is taking the issue seriously, improving its calculations and explaining the differences in a scientific way 

Detailed explanations [here](https://twitter.com/maeool/status/1453282887583866885).

So why do we show an average of 9.8 tons in the simulator? Because our calculation is made using another method than the government one, complementary. More info [here](https://github.com/datagir/nosgestesclimat-site/issues/365#issuecomment-957321261).

## Conference mode improvements 🏟️

This collective mode of using ourclimategests is more and more used. To facilitate the sharing of the link at the beginning of the conference, we generate a super QRCode that you just have to project or send by email![Capture d’écran du 2021-11-02 11-32-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/139830597-63fe1856-5622-4c52-b7f4-23ccbfaa6bd9.png)

Another improvement is that we exclude from the group's results simulations that have resulted in a footprint that is too high, above 100 tons. This limit will be configurable soon 

## Technical improvements 🐇

We continue to lighten the site, removing a graphic animation library (react-spring) and better cutting the conference mode from the rest of the application 

Of course, many reported bugs have also been fixed.

body:
[![](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Glacier_de_la_Grande_Casse_le_13_ao%C3%BBt_2016.JPG/640px-Glacier_de_la_Grande_Casse_le_13_ao%C3%BBt_2016.JPG)](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glacier%5Fdes%5FGrands%5FCouloirs)

> In short: we listen to each and every one of your feedbacks, and the improvement continues 🔄

## 👂 We're listening to you!

We've sorted and responded to over 300 feedbacks since the launch of Our Climate Gestures, all on [the 'issues' tab.](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/issues)

This allows us to understand the problems of the calculator to prioritize its improvement.

## Some simulation improvements

🚴 Cyclosphere, hello! The issue of cycling makes its appearance in the simulator, and in the "go to work other than by car" action, which replaces "go to work by public transport". Walking 🚶♀️ and other modes are not left out obviously 🛴![Capture d’écran du 2021-02-08 15-42-24](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1177762/107234732-4097f700-6a24-11eb-9f54-ff64cf66183f.png)

We'll let you guess the impact this quesiton has on the results ;) 

We have also improved the input guides (e.g. number of houses: is it with or without me?)

🤳 The phone question has been revised, now that all recent phones are larger than 5 inches, and to take into account the 'no smartphone' option.

🔥🌲 The heating in steres of wood question becomes more relevant: it's counted in steres, not kWh. We will continue to improve the other entries soon (wood in pellets, fuel oil).

## Other improvements

New features (like this one you are reading) now appear directly on [https://nosgestesclimat.fr/nouveautés,](https://nosgestesclimat.fr/nouveaut%C3%A9s) it's still more accessible than [on github](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/releases) 🙂 

🐛 Several quite important bugs have been solved thanks to your feedback (end of simulation always at 11 tons, default value input -> no "next" button, etc.)

## Our roadmap

Now that the "issues" onget is clearer, it was time to put online our roadmap on the simulator / calculation model side, it is in the ["Projects" section](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-data/projects/1). Everything is indicative, but it allows you to know what are our current topics 

> As for the interface, [this is the place](https://github.com/betagouv/ecolab-climat/milestones) to go to follow the progress.
